title: What are the most important philosophy works? - Quora

response.answer_text: As I see it, these works are often overlooked by serious philosophers, but deserve a lot of attention: Programmable Heuristics by Nathan CoppedgeLarger set: Coherent SystemsA valuable summary of the History of PhilosophyExplodism: Critiques of science.Since my partial experiments were successful, there may be a growing importance for ‘philosophical engineering’: Simple Mathematical Proof of Perpetual MotionSelect Machines - YouTube
Crumbs. Take your choice: The Discourse upon method, by Descartes, Wittgenstein’s Tractatus; The Principia Mathematica, Whitehead and Russell, Plato’s Republic, Kant’s Moral Law…
